line_1: Fierce Love abates his usual Mettle:
line_2: As People marry now, and settle;

line_1: May be thrown in; And for the Mettle,
line_2: The Coin may mend a Tinker's Kettle —

line_1: But sax Scotch mile, thou try't their mettle,
But sax Scotch mile, thou try't their mettle,
line_2: Might aiblins waur't thee for a brattle;

line_1: But sax Scotch mile, thou try't their mettle,
line_2: Nae whip nor spur, but just a wattle

line_1: Arouse my boys! exert your mettle,
line_2: To get auld Scotland back her kettle!

line_1: Arouse my boys! exert your mettle,
line_2: Or faith! I'll wad my new pleugh-pettle,

line_1: Arouse my boys! exert your mettle,
line_2: She'll teach you, wi' a reekan whittle,
